name: Pop Culture & Fun: The Ultimate Mixed Trivia Pack
author: Obot
description: A lively quiz pack spanning music, gaming, internet culture, and general knowledge. Each round explores a different fan-favorite topic, from Green Day to Minecraft to memes and more!

rounds.theme_description: Questions inspired by the music and legacy of Green Day.

questions.question: What is the name of Green Day's breakthrough 1994 album that includes the hits 'Basket Case' and 'When I Come Around'?
questions.explanation: Green Day's 'Dookie' was a massive success and brought punk rock into the mainstream in the 1990s.

questions.question: Which Green Day song begins with the lyrics, 'Do you have the time to listen to me whine'?
questions.explanation: 'Basket Case' is one of Green Day's most iconic songs, opening with those memorable lyrics.

questions.question: Green Day's lead singer is Billie Joe Armstrong.
questions.explanation: Billie Joe Armstrong is the frontman and primary songwriter for Green Day.

questions.question: In what year was Green Day inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame?
questions.explanation: Green Day was inducted in 2015, recognizing their influence on modern rock.

questions.question: Which Green Day album features the song 'American Idiot'?
questions.explanation: The album 'American Idiot' was released in 2004 and became a cultural phenomenon.

questions.question: Which instrument does Mike Dirnt play in Green Day?
questions.explanation: Mike Dirnt is Green Day's bassist and provides backing vocals.

rounds.theme_description: Set sail with questions about the world of One Piece.

questions.question: What is the name of the main protagonist in One Piece?
questions.explanation: Luffy is the rubber-powered captain of the Straw Hat Pirates.

questions.question: Which fruit did Luffy eat to gain his powers?
questions.explanation: The Gomu Gomu no Mi is a Devil Fruit that gives Luffy his rubber abilities.

questions.question: Zoro is known for fighting with three swords at once.
questions.explanation: Roronoa Zoro is famous for his unique three-sword style.

questions.question: As of 2024, approximately how many episodes of the One Piece anime have aired?
questions.explanation: One Piece is one of the longest-running anime series, surpassing 1,100 episodes by 2024.

questions.question: What is the name of the treasure that Luffy seeks?
questions.explanation: The legendary treasure 'One Piece' is said to be at the end of the Grand Line.

questions.question: Which Straw Hat crew member is the ship's navigator?
questions.explanation: Nami is the skilled navigator of the Straw Hat Pirates.

rounds.theme_description: Explore the magical universe of Skylanders.

questions.question: What is the name of the main villain in the Skylanders series?
questions.explanation: Kaos is the recurring antagonist in the Skylanders games.

questions.question: Which element is Spyro associated with in Skylanders?
questions.explanation: In Skylanders, Spyro is classified as a Magic element character.

questions.question: Skylanders figures use NFC technology to interact with the game.
questions.explanation: The figures use NFC chips to transfer character data into the game.

questions.question: How many main Skylanders games were released between 2011 and 2016?
questions.explanation: There were six main Skylanders games released in that period.

questions.question: What is the name of the device used to bring Skylanders into the game?
questions.explanation: The Portal of Power is the platform that reads Skylanders figures.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a Skylanders element?
questions.explanation: Wind is not an element in the Skylanders universe.

rounds.theme_description: Test your knowledge of Fortnite's world and history.

questions.question: What is the name of Fortnite's in-game currency?
questions.explanation: V-Bucks are used to purchase skins, emotes, and more in Fortnite.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a Fortnite location?
questions.explanation: Sunny Shores is not a named location in Fortnite.

questions.question: Fortnite was first released in 2017.
questions.explanation: Fortnite's Battle Royale mode launched in 2017.

questions.question: How many players compete in a standard Fortnite Battle Royale match?
questions.explanation: A typical Fortnite match features 100 players fighting to be the last one standing.

questions.question: What is the name of the storm's safe area that shrinks over time?
questions.explanation: Players must stay inside the shrinking circle to survive the storm.

questions.question: Which company developed Fortnite?
questions.explanation: Epic Games is the developer and publisher of Fortnite.

rounds.theme_description: A round dedicated to meme culture and viral moments.

questions.question: What animal is featured in the 'Doge' meme?
questions.explanation: The 'Doge' meme features a Shiba Inu dog with multicolored Comic Sans text.

questions.question: Which phrase is associated with the 'Distracted Boyfriend' meme?
questions.explanation: The meme shows a man looking at another woman while his girlfriend looks on disapprovingly.

questions.question: 'Pepe the Frog' originated as a character in a comic strip.
questions.explanation: Pepe first appeared in Matt Furie's comic 'Boys Club.'

questions.question: In what year did the 'Rickroll' meme first appear on YouTube?
questions.explanation: The 'Rickroll' meme began in 2007, tricking users into watching Rick Astley's 'Never Gonna Give You Up.'

questions.question: What is the name of the meme featuring a white cat sitting at a dinner table?
questions.explanation: The meme combines a scene from 'The Real Housewives' with a confused-looking cat at a table.

questions.question: Which meme is known for the phrase 'Is this a pigeon?'?
questions.explanation: The 'Is this a pigeon?' meme comes from a scene in the anime 'The Brave Fighter of Sun Fighbird.'

rounds.theme_description: Dig into the world of Minecraft, from crafting to creatures.

questions.question: What is the name of the dimension you reach by building a portal with obsidian and lighting it?
questions.explanation: The Nether is a dangerous, lava-filled dimension in Minecraft.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a Minecraft mob?
questions.explanation: Golemite is not a real mob in Minecraft.

questions.question: You can craft a diamond pickaxe using only two diamonds.
questions.explanation: A diamond pickaxe requires three diamonds and two sticks.

questions.question: How many blocks high is a standard Minecraft player character?
questions.explanation: The player is 1.8 blocks tall in Minecraft.

questions.question: What is the rarest ore in Minecraft as of 2024?
questions.explanation: Ancient Debris is used to make Netherite and is the rarest naturally occurring ore.

questions.question: Which item is needed to tame a wolf in Minecraft?
questions.explanation: Bones are used to tame wolves and turn them into loyal dogs.

rounds.theme_description: Pop into the world of Bloons TD6 and its tower defense mayhem.

questions.question: What is the main objective in Bloons TD6?
questions.explanation: Players must prevent bloons from reaching the end of the path by popping them with towers.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a monkey tower in Bloons TD6?
questions.explanation: There is no tower called Pirate Monkey, though there is a Monkey Buccaneer.

questions.question: Bloons TD6 can be played in co-op mode.
questions.explanation: Co-op mode allows players to team up and defend together.

questions.question: How many upgrade paths does each tower have in Bloons TD6?
questions.explanation: Each tower has three upgrade paths, but only two can be used at once.

questions.question: What is the name of the most powerful type of bloon, which is black and red and spawns other blimps?
questions.explanation: The BAD (Big Airship of Doom) is the toughest bloon in the game.

questions.question: Which currency is used to unlock new heroes in Bloons TD6?
questions.explanation: Monkey Money is earned by playing and used to unlock heroes and other features.

rounds.theme_description: A round about Mr. Beast and his wild YouTube stunts.

questions.question: What is Mr. Beast's real first name?
questions.explanation: Mr. Beast's real name is Jimmy Donaldson.

questions.question: Which of these challenges did Mr. Beast NOT do?
questions.explanation: Mr. Beast has done many wild challenges, but swimming the English Channel is not one of them.

questions.question: Mr. Beast has given away over $1 million in a single video.
questions.explanation: He is known for his massive giveaways and philanthropy.

questions.question: As of 2024, approximately how many subscribers does Mr. Beast's main YouTube channel have?
questions.explanation: Mr. Beast's channel surpassed 250 million subscribers in 2024, making it one of the most-subscribed on YouTube.

questions.question: What is the name of Mr. Beast's tree-planting campaign?
questions.explanation: Team Trees aimed to plant 20 million trees worldwide.

questions.question: Which of these is a frequent collaborator in Mr. Beast's videos?
questions.explanation: Chris Tyson is a longtime friend and collaborator in Mr. Beast's videos.

rounds.theme_description: A taste of cooking, food, and culinary basics.

questions.question: What is the term for cooking pasta until it is firm to the bite?
questions.explanation: 'Al dente' means the pasta is cooked but still has a slight firmness.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a type of knife cut?
questions.explanation: Frittata is an Italian egg dish, not a knife cut.

questions.question: Baking powder and baking soda are the same thing.
questions.explanation: They are different leavening agents with distinct chemical properties.

questions.question: At what temperature in Fahrenheit does water boil at sea level?
questions.explanation: Water boils at 212°F (100°C) at sea level.

questions.question: What is the main ingredient in guacamole?
questions.explanation: Guacamole is a dip made primarily from mashed avocados.

questions.question: Which vitamin is most abundant in citrus fruits?
questions.explanation: Citrus fruits are an excellent source of vitamin C.

rounds.theme_description: A round of general knowledge every elementary student should know.

questions.question: What is the largest planet in our solar system?
questions.explanation: Jupiter is the biggest planet, known for its Great Red Spot.

questions.question: Which continent is Egypt located on?
questions.explanation: Egypt is a country in northeastern Africa.

questions.question: A triangle has four sides.
questions.explanation: A triangle has three sides.

questions.question: How many states are there in the United States?
questions.explanation: The U.S. is made up of 50 states.

questions.question: What do plants use to make food from sunlight?
questions.explanation: Photosynthesis is the process by which plants convert sunlight into energy.

questions.question: Which of these is a mammal?
questions.explanation: Dolphins are warm-blooded mammals that breathe air.
